content:
Before creating messaging components for agents to send in messaging sessions, review important considerations.

Messaging components are supported only in enhanced Messaging channels and Messaging for In-App and Web. Enhanced bots can send enhanced links, time selectors, and questions with options.

Auto-response components are supported only in Messaging for In-App and Web and Bring Your Own Channel. Agents see a generic placeholder when an auto-response component is sent.

Enhanced link components are available only in the Text format in enhanced WhatsApp channels. Form messaging components must be linked to a global "Create a record" action that creates a custom object or one of these standard objects: Case, Contact, Order, Product, and Asset.

Notification messaging components can be sent manually using the messaging component action in the messaging window, or via a flow using the Send Conversation Messages flow action. To be sent in a WhatsApp channel, a notification messaging component must be linked to a WhatsApp messaging template that is created in WhatsApp Business Manager and approved by WhatsApp.

Buttons and dynamic footers aren’t supported in WhatsApp templates that are linked to a notification component, and should be removed from the template in WhatsApp Business Manager.

Question with options and time selector messaging components have limitations in enhanced WhatsApp channels: Images don't appear with list options, and long option text is truncated.

Payment components for Apple Pay payments made in Apple Messages for Business channels via a payment messaging components are supported only in the sandbox. Don’t add Apple Pay to your channel in production.
title: Considerations for Creating Messaging Components
